Magnetic Fields and Forces.title: Analyzing the Earth’s Magnetosphere
objectives: Understand the structure and function of Earth's magnetosphere.
Explore how Earth's magnetic field interacts with solar wind.
Analyze protective effects of the magnetosphere on Earth.
tasks: Clearly diagram Earth's magnetosphere, labeling key features (magnetopause, bow shock, radiation belts).
Explain how solar wind particles interact with Earth’s magnetic field, illustrating their trajectories and deflection clearly.
physics_concepts: Charged particle motion in magnetic fields
Lorentz force: F = q v B sin(θ)

Magnetic Fields and Forces.title: Magnetic Torque on Satellites (Attitude Control Systems)
objectives: Understand how spacecraft use magnetic fields for attitude control.
Analyze how torque is generated using magnetorquers.
tasks: Explain the generation of magnetic torque clearly with labeled diagrams.
Discuss how satellite orientation adjustments are made through controlled currents in magnetorquers.
physics_concepts: Right-hand rule for magnetic force and torque
Torque equation: τ = μ B sin(θ)
Magnetic moment of coil: μ = NIA

Magnetic Fields and Forces.title: Particle Accelerators and Magnetic Fields
objectives: Explain the role of magnetic fields in particle accelerators.
Understand how charged particles' trajectories are influenced by magnetic fields.
tasks: Illustrate clearly how magnetic fields steer particle beams in cyclotrons or synchrotrons.
Explain conceptually why magnetic fields change direction, but not speed of charged particles.
physics_concepts: Circular motion of charged particles in magnetic fields
Lorentz force: F = q v B
Centripetal force balance: q v B = m v²/r

Magnetic Fields and Forces.title: Radiation Belts (Van Allen Belts)
objectives: Describe Earth's radiation belts and their formation.
Analyze how charged particles become trapped in Earth's magnetic field.
tasks: Explain clearly and diagrammatically how particles are trapped and move within the Van Allen belts.
Discuss hazards posed by radiation belts to spacecraft and astronauts.

Magnetic Fields and Forces.title: Medical Application: Proton Therapy (Magnetic Steering)
objectives: Understand the physical principles of proton therapy.
Explain how magnetic fields precisely direct proton beams in medical treatment.
tasks: Clearly illustrate how magnets steer proton beams.
Explain with diagrams and/or animations the trajectory of charged protons in magnetic fields used in therapy.
physics_concepts: Charged particle motion in magnetic fields
Lorentz force: F = q v B
Relationship between magnetic field strength, particle speed, and path radius

Course-Wide Projects.title: Home Energy Audit (Applied Circuit Analysis)
objectives: Apply Ohm’s Law and power equations to household systems.
Understand circuit load balancing and power usage.
tasks: Choose several real or hypothetical appliances and estimate current and power use.
Design a basic home circuit with branches and calculate expected loads and voltage drops.
Evaluate safety margins and propose improvements for circuit safety.

Course-Wide Projects.title: Voltage Divider Design for Sensor Systems
objectives: Design voltage dividers for real-world use cases like sensors.
Analyze circuit behavior under changing inputs and loads.
tasks: Design a voltage divider for a specific input/output constraint (e.g., reducing 12V to 5V).
Explain limitations, power dissipation, and stability.
Optional: Propose resistor substitutions or improvements.

Course-Wide Projects.title: Troubleshooting a Mystery Circuit
objectives: Apply Kirchhoff's laws to a multi-loop circuit.
Develop circuit analysis and debugging skills.
tasks: Solve a complex circuit with missing or inconsistent values.
Use Kirchhoff’s Laws to identify and resolve faults or inefficiencies.
Optional: Design an improved version of the circuit.
physics_concepts: Kirchhoff’s Loop Rule and Junction Rule

Course-Wide Projects.title: Designing a Wireless Power Transfer System
objectives: Explore magnetic induction in wireless energy systems.
Understand coil alignment and efficiency.
tasks: Model a system of two coils for wireless charging.
Calculate mutual inductance and efficiency based on spacing and alignment.
Explain induced EMF and power transfer with diagrams or simulations.

Course-Wide Projects.title: Regenerative Braking in Electric Vehicles
objectives: Analyze kinetic-to-electrical energy conversion in EVs.
Explore how electromagnetic induction aids energy recovery.
tasks: Model the braking process in terms of induced EMF and energy conversion.
Estimate power recovered under certain vehicle speeds and conditions.
Discuss limitations and future improvements in EV designs.
